function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Widespread use of community volunteers without financial support","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Normalization of existing disease patterns and organizational methods","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate community participation and empowerment","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited examples of institutionalizing participatory approaches in developing countries with limited resources and weak institutional support","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inequalities at the local level and gatekeepers silencing community groups from participating and having a voice","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Long-term collaboration and stakeholder engagement required for successful disease mitigation initiatives","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Primary health care networks as an organizational base","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate monitoring of drug resistance","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Intensive educational program emphasizing prevention and curative medicine","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Local ecological factors driving site-specific interventions may not be scalable and applicable in different regions, leading to ineffective disease control measures","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of community awareness about the relationships between vector-borne diseases and social, environmental, and climatic determinants may hinder the effectiveness of community-based interventions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"The lack of national ownership and government-driven initiatives may hinder the effective scale-up of disease control efforts, leading to limited impact at a national level","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Differential impact on different social groups due to vector-borne diseases transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited access to government outreach programs and socio-economic development opportunities for women","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vulnerable children under 5 and pregnant women at heightened risk of vector-borne diseases","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Barriers to vbd prevention, treatment, and control in tribal communities due to geographic, cultural, and social factors","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of knowledge and awareness among mobile and migrant populations about antimalarial drugs and treatment compliance","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited research on the effectiveness of community participation in malaria control programs","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Marginalization of community participation in global malaria efforts","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Spread of artemisinin-resistant malaria among mobile and migrant populations in Cambodia","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Stigmatization of vulnerable social groups in malaria interventions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Local perceptions and cultural norms may influence the acceptability and adaptability of program tools for disease control","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Over-reliance on one or two disease control tools may lead to ineffective and unsustainable disease control efforts","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Underdeveloped integrated vector management due to funding challenges, inter-sectoral cooperation, effective policy frameworks, and disciplinary divides","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of large-scale trials for integrated vector control approach for diseases like malaria, leishmaniasis, lymphatic filariasis, and dengue","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Narrow focus in disease elimination programs neglecting common vectors transmitting multiple diseases in the same communities , global programme to eliminate lymphatic filariasis","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of aedes aegypti breeding sites in water containers in dengue-endemic areas","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential transmission of schistosomiasis in China","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High prevalence of guppies around households","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Challenges of maintaining guppy distribution system","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High malaria transmission related to vulnerable populations","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of integration between disease elimination and broader health and development issues.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Synergies between elimination efforts for various diseases may not be fully exploited.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Difficulties in prioritization as elimination-targeted diseases become less common at community and country levels.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of synergy between top-down and bottom-up approaches","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Bottlenecks at the top of the health system","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Emphasis on unsustainable pilot studies","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of adaptive implementation of tailored programmes in the health system","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in the range of local snail host due to changes in the marshland ecosystem and sociodemographic shifts","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Re-emergence of the disease due to the completion of the three gorges dam","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Annual reinfection of up to 20% of people due to occupational risks","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Bureaucratic and institutional inflexibility leading to lack of tailored approaches","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of evidence on the impact of community-based approaches on epidemiological trends and cost-effectiveness","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Challenges in enacting mitigation efforts in the absence of epidemics and high numbers of human cases","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Need for capacity building at multiple levels for effective community-based interventions","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainties in modeling efforts for policy design and programmatic orientation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of incorporation of community-based approaches and diverse issues in vbd strategies","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate response to global commitments in addressing vbd scenarios","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of political will and funding for scale-up of disease prevention and control tools","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Challenge in scaling-up, financing, and institutionalizing community empowerment approaches to vector-borne diseases","category":"Society","confidence":"High"}]}
